Hi Richard,
I found a few municipalities that have sections of their websites that discuss vacant housing registries (Minneapolis, Washington DC, and Elk Grove, California.

http://www.elkgrovecity.org/code-enforcement/vacant-property.asp
http://www.minneapolismn.gov/inspections/inspections_ch249list
Elk Grove and Minneapolis collect fees, but DC doesn't clearly state that they do. I hope this helps. If you need any further assistance, my contact information is below.
Alex Rivera

answers.author: Michael Smith
answers.text:
Dick,
The City of Oklahoma City is currently studying the effects and cost that vacant and abandoned properties are having on city services and what actions Oklahoma City might consider to reduce those negative impacts on our City and citizens.  While the situations across the nation are far from identical, the challenges that communities face from vacant and abandoned properties are similar: reduced nearby property values, increased criminal activities, accelerated community decline, and an increased need for city services.  Evidence shows these properties are an expense that local government simply can’t afford and the expense and blight grows with every year a property remains vacant.  In response to those demands, we are preparing a report for City Council considering a possible property registration and fee for the disproportionate cost of these properties, which we expect to be forthcoming in the next few months.  The best source that we have found in our research for a comprehensive listing of local and state governments with vacant property registration is at http://www.safeguardproperties.com/Resources/Vacant_Property_Registration/Default.aspx?filter=vpr
They have several examples from cities/counties in GA.
Feel free to contact me in a few months to see if we have a final report.
Michael J. Smith
405.297.2268
michael.smith2@okc.gov

author: Richard Newbern
text:
I am Demolition Coordinator for the City of Brunswick, Georgia. Are there any local governments with ICMA that have " Vacant Housing Registries" that require homeowners to register their vacant houses with City Hall and pay the City an annual fee for police protection, inspection and maintenance?
Thank you.
Dick Newbern
ICMA FM
title: Vacant Property Registries with an annual fee
